column169: XPO notified ERTS regarding a punctured box containing (4) 1-gallon jugs of Instant Power Main Line Cleaner that were punctured as a result of dunnage. This resulted in 1-gallon release of product onto it’s outer cardboard  box and the wooden trailer floor. A Contractor neutralized the release with vinegar and generated one drum of  waste for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

column169: A 25-pound paper bag tore from bracing against the trailer during transit. A release of regulated UN1477 "Tracite 20-10-20 W/ Micros" that arrived damaged at the Terminal. No Drains, Soils, or waterways were reported impacted.
column199: EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND TRAINING SOLUTIONS, INCORPORATED

column169: XPO Logistics terminal XSB experienced a UN1823 Caustic Soda Micropearls release from (2) 50-pound paper bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30 pounds of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of a pallet located on the dock floor due to improper loading/handling. The damaged bags of product, released product, and impacted pallet wood were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

On 4/2/2024 at approximately 1430, Dangerous Goods Adminsitration received a call from Employee 3785111 at the hub facility in Guangzhou, reporting a flammable liquid spill.  The shipment consisted of 2 plastic jerricans, packaged in a fiberboard box.  The shipment was discovered to have leaked due to a forklift accident.  One of the plastic jerrican was damaged, resulting in total loss of that inner container.  Due to the current location of this shipment, the shipment is unable to transport further and will be prepared for disposal.

column169: Approximately 1800 on 4/2/2024 an employee was conducting a yard check and discovered a liquid leaking from the back of a trailer. A clean up team was contacted and proceeded to contain leak and clean up spill. Approximately five gallons was released. Spill was cleaned up and repacked for transport.
column170: Drum had small leak on the side where a screw in the side of the trailer rubbed through the side if the drum. Steps have been taken to ensure trailer have no more screws or protrusions to cause these types of occurrences.

column169: On April 1, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3901 was damaged in transit due to unknown causes and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer floor, pallets, and concrete. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnvioServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The impacted pallet was dismantled for disposal. The dismantled pallet, the damaged drum, all UN3901 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 85-gallon overpack drum and nine (9) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

column169: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1993 Rain-X Deicer -25 Degree Windshield Washer Fluid release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 7’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor and a 10’ x 23’ area of the concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents were then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN1992 Activ-8 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup of the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30 -gallons of product released to the entire trailer floor and a 15’ x 10’ area of the asphalt and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then deployed to clean the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, pads, and PPE were then containerized into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

column63: Forklift Accident; Forklift Accident; Forklift Accident; Impact with Sharp or Protruding Object (e.g., nails); Impact with Sharp or Protruding Object (e.g., nails); Impact with Sharp or Protruding Object (e.g., nails)
column169: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced an over the road release of UN1866 Tremco Puma Primer from a 6-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released due to a broken pallet puncturing the pail. The majority of the release impacted a 6’ x 4’ area of the wooden trailer floor with approximately 1 cup impacting a 3” x 6” area of the gravel rocks below the trailer. The damaged pail was collected with oil dri into a 55-gallon metal drum. Absorbent pads were then used to clean the impacted trailer and crew utilized hand tools to scrap up the impacted rocks. The impacted rags, damaged pallet, impacted gravel rocks, PPE, and poly were placed into a separate 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was transported back to the XPO terminal in Phoenix, AZ for terminal personnel to manage.

column169: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 5 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING DUMPLINGS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR SERVICE. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER G801X2, STEAMIES DUMPLINGS, 12548 PRESTON WAY, LOS ANGELES CA 90066-1824.

column169: Juan Gonzalez Service Center Manager called to report a spill of UN3286, FLAMMABLE LIQUID TOXIC CORROSIVE N.O.S. 3 (6.1, 8), PG II, in trailer 87159. Juan stated when the crew went to open the doors on the trailer to unload they saw a product from a 55 gallon drum has leaked on to the trailer floor and reported a strong smell coming from inside the trailer. Juan stated it looked to be 3 gallons that spilled on the trailer floor and may be more under the pallet but could not see. Juan request a cleaning crew to assist with the spill clean up in trailer 87159.
column170: Refresher training on loading and unloading freight and inspecting for any thing that could damage or cause a spill during loading.

column169: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN3266 Chemtreat FlexPro CL5793 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of product released to the poly tote packaging only. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with oil dri and PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

XPO-LEP contacted ERTS regarding a box containing (2) 1-gallon jugs of Blue Whale Muriatic Acid that were  punctured by a forklift and leaking 2-gallons of product onto the concrete dock floor. A Contractor neutralized  the release using Soda Ash and cleaned the spill with Oil Dry. Two drums of waste were generated for disposal.  No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

column169: XPO Logistics terminal NCH experienced a UN1824 Greasestrip Plus release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs as well as a release of UN3264 Lime-A-Way from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of each product, (4-gallons combined) released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Soda ash solution and oil dri were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted area. All impacted absorbents, cardboard, PPE, and the two empty pails of UN3264 Lime-A-Way were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The two empty jugs, and two damaged jugs of UN1824 Greasestrip Plus were placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
